title: Schnals
text:
Schnals (; ) is a "<a href="comune">comune</a>" (municipality) in the autonomous province of <a href="South%20Tyrol">South Tyrol</a> in northern <a href="Italy">Italy</a>, located about northwest of the city of <a href="Bolzano">Bolzano</a>, on the border with <a href="Austria">Austria</a>. The municipality includes large parts of the <a href="Schnalstal">Schnalstal</a>.
Geography.
As of 30 November 2010, it had a population of 1,345 and an area of .
Schnals borders the following municipalities: <a href="Kastelbell-Tschars">Kastelbell-Tschars</a>, <a href="Latsch">Latsch</a>, <a href="Mals">Mals</a>, <a href="Moos%20in%20Passeier">Moos in Passeier</a>, <a href="Naturns">Naturns</a>, <a href="Partschins">Partschins</a>, <a href="Schlanders">Schlanders</a>, and <a href="S%C3%B6lden">Sölden</a> (Austria).
Frazioni.
The municipality of Schnals contains the "<a href="frazione">frazioni</a>" (subdivisions, mainly villages and hamlets) Karthaus (Certosa), and Katharinaberg (Monte Santa Caterina), Unser Frau (Madonna).
History.
Coat-of-arms.
The shield is <a href="Azure%20%28heraldry%29">azure</a> and <a href="argent">argent</a> <a href="division%20of%20the%20field">party per pale</a>. The first part represents <a href="Gabriel">Gabriel</a> of <a href="or%20%28heraldry%29">or</a> with a <a href="sword">sword</a> in his right hand over the head, and a <a href="weighing%20scale">scales</a> in the left, standing on a <a href="sable%20%28heraldry%29">sable</a> <a href="dragon">dragon</a> with a <a href="gules">gules</a> tongue. Three azure gyrons, with the point on the division, are in the second part. The shield represents the patron saint of the Carthusian Abbey of Allerengelberg and the arms of the Lords of Schandersberg. The emblem was adopted in 1967.
Society.
Linguistic distribution.
According to the 2011 census, 98.24% of the population speak <a href="German%20language">German</a> and 1.76% <a href="Italian%20language">Italian</a> as first language.
